main event: Three objects, the size of a pin head, were observed traveling with intermittent motion for 3 minutes in Colorado Springs, Colorado on September 29, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were described as silver-white in color.
The objects were first spotted by children, who called attention to them.
The objects were moving north and then moving away.
The objects faded from view after 3 minutes of observation.
The report includes a hand-drawn sketch depicting the unidentified aerial phenomenon.
sighted object: three silver-white objects the size of a pin head
